item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S256)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S256)

summary.text: Psychiatric and Psychological Examinations Act of 2005 - Amends the Federal criminal code to allow the psychiatric or psychological examinations required for the determination of mental capacity to stand trial and the determination of the existence of insanity at the time of an offense to be conducted by clinical social workers.

bill.title: Psychiatric and Psychological Examinations Act of 2005

item.title: Psychiatric and Psychological Examinations Act of 2005
Psychiatric and Psychological Examinations Act of 2005

A bill to allow the psychiatric or psychological examinations required under chapter 313 of title 18, United States Code, relating to offenders with mental disease or defect, to be conducted by a clinical social worker.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S256)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
